title: Contributing to sdtm.terminology
text: outlines propose change sdtm.terminology. detailed discussion contributing package, please see tidyverse guidelines, namely development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to sdtm.terminology
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to sdtm.terminology
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to sdtm.terminology
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("patterninstitute/sdtm.terminology", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to sdtm.terminology
text: use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to sdtm.terminology
text: Please note sdtm.terminology project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology
text: sdtm.terminology R data package providing CDISC SDTM terminology. CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology refers standardized set terms developed Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) specifically use Standard Data Tabulation Model (SDTM). Controlled terminology provides consistent vocabulary coding various types data collected clinical trials. standardization crucial ensuring data different studies, sponsors, sites can understood, compared, analyzed consistent manner. addition supplying SDTM terminology data, package includes several utility functions designed facilitate conversion codes terms, well verify association terms specific code lists.

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("patterninstitute/sdtm.terminology")

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology
text: current controlled terminology release bundled package :
code: # SDTM controlled terminology version ct_release() #> [1] "2025-03-25"

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology
code: # SDTM terms (other than code lists) ct() #> # A tibble: 43,698 × 7 #>    clst_code code    term                              name    syn   def   nci   #>    <chr>     <chr>   <chr>                             <chr>   <chr> <chr> <chr> #>  1 C141657   C174106 TENMW101                          10-Met… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  2 C141657   C141700 TENMW102                          10-Met… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  3 C141657   C147592 TENMW103                          10-Met… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  4 C141657   C141701 TENMW104                          10-Met… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  5 C141656   C141701 TENMW1-Test Grade                 10-Met… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  6 C141656   C141700 TENMW1-Time to Walk/Run 10 Meters 10-Met… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  7 C141656   C174106 TENMW1-Was Walk/Run Performed     10-Met… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  8 C141656   C147592 TENMW1-Wear Orthoses              10-Met… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  9 C141663   C174103 A4STR101                          4-Stai… A4ST… 4-St… 4-St… #> 10 C141663   C141706 A4STR102                          4-Stai… A4ST… 4-St… 4-St… #> # ℹ 43,688 more rows

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology
code: # SDTM code lists ct("list") #> # A tibble: 1,158 × 9 #>    clst_code is_clst code    term          ext   name          syn   def   nci   #>    <chr>     <lgl>   <chr>   <chr>         <lgl> <chr>         <chr> <chr> <chr> #>  1 C141657   TRUE    C141657 TENMW1TC      FALSE 10-Meter Wal… 10-M… 10-M… CDIS… #>  2 C141656   TRUE    C141656 TENMW1TN      FALSE 10-Meter Wal… 10-M… 10-M… CDIS… #>  3 C141663   TRUE    C141663 A4STR1TC      FALSE 4-Stair Asce… 4-St… 4-St… CDIS… #>  4 C141662   TRUE    C141662 A4STR1TN      FALSE 4-Stair Asce… 4-St… 4-St… CDIS… #>  5 C141661   TRUE    C141661 D4STR1TC      FALSE 4-Stair Desc… 4-St… 4-St… CDIS… #>  6 C141660   TRUE    C141660 D4STR1TN      FALSE 4-Stair Desc… 4-St… 4-St… CDIS… #>  7 C115388   TRUE    C115388 SIXMW1TC      FALSE 6 Minute Wal… 6 Mi… 6 Mi… CDIS… #>  8 C115387   TRUE    C115387 SIXMW1TN      FALSE 6 Minute Wal… 6 Mi… 6 Mi… CDIS… #>  9 C182464   TRUE    C182464 AIMS0101T07OR FALSE Abnormal Inv… Abno… Abno… CDIS… #> 10 C182465   TRUE    C182465 AIMS0108T09OR FALSE Abnormal Inv… Abno… Abno… CDIS… #> # ℹ 1,148 more rows

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology
code: # SDTM terminology individual terms and code list terms. ct("all") #> # A tibble: 44,856 × 9 #>    clst_code is_clst code    term                  ext   name  syn   def   nci   #>    <chr>     <lgl>   <chr>   <chr>                 <lgl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> #>  1 C141657   TRUE    C141657 TENMW1TC              FALSE 10-M… 10-M… 10-M… CDIS… #>  2 C141657   FALSE   C174106 TENMW101              NA    10-M… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  3 C141657   FALSE   C141700 TENMW102              NA    10-M… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  4 C141657   FALSE   C147592 TENMW103              NA    10-M… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  5 C141657   FALSE   C141701 TENMW104              NA    10-M… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  6 C141656   TRUE    C141656 TENMW1TN              FALSE 10-M… 10-M… 10-M… CDIS… #>  7 C141656   FALSE   C141701 TENMW1-Test Grade     NA    10-M… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  8 C141656   FALSE   C141700 TENMW1-Time to Walk/… NA    10-M… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #>  9 C141656   FALSE   C174106 TENMW1-Was Walk/Run … NA    10-M… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #> 10 C141656   FALSE   C147592 TENMW1-Wear Orthoses  NA    10-M… TENM… 10-M… 10-M… #> # ℹ 44,846 more rows

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology
text: Convert terms codes codes terms, determine term included terminology code list:
code: # Convert a code list term to respective C-code and back again clst_term_to_code("UNIT") #> [1] "C71620" clst_code_to_term("C71620") #> [1] "UNIT" # Are "%" and "%/s" terms from the UNIT code list? is_term(c("%", "%/s"), clst_term_to_code("UNIT")) #> [1] TRUE TRUE # Find "%" and "%/s" codes within C71620 code list. term_to_code(c("%", "%/s"), "C71620") #> [1] "C25613"  "C163560" # It seems "%" is also a term in the VSRESU code list but not "%/s". is_term(c("%", "%/s"), clst_term_to_code("VSRESU")) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE # Or, equivalently, query using codes instead... is_code(c("C25613", "C163560"), clst_term_to_code("VSRESU")) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE # Find which code lists contain the terms "DNA" or "RNA" match_code_list_from_term(c("DNA", "RNA")) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   code    term  clst_code #>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>     #> 1 C184459 DNA   C101832   #> 2 C449    DNA   C111114   #> 3 C135409 DNA   C65047    #> 4 C184459 DNA   C163027   #> 5 C812    RNA   C111114   #> 6 C132301 RNA   C65047 # Round trip from terms to codes to parent code list codes... match_code_list_from_code(term_to_code(c("%", "%/s"), "C71620")) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   code    term  clst_code #>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>     #> 1 C25613  %     C85494    #> 2 C25613  %     C71620    #> 3 C25613  %     C66770    #> 4 C163560 %/s   C71620

what: SDTM codelist code to respective term — clst_code_to_term
title: SDTM codelist code to respective term — clst_code_to_term
text: clst_code_to_term() maps SDTM terminology codelists' C-codes respective terms. mapping codes representing codelists, use code_to_term() instead.

title: SDTM codelist code to respective term — clst_code_to_term
code: clst_code_to_term(code)

title: SDTM codelist code to respective term — clst_code_to_term
text: code C-code leading character C followed sequence digits used uniquely identifying SDTM terminology codelist.

title: SDTM codelist code to respective term — clst_code_to_term
text: character vector SDTM terms codelists. number elements returned matches number elements code, .e. one--one correspondence input output. Invalid codes code mapped NA.

title: SDTM codelist code to respective term — clst_code_to_term
code: clst_code_to_term(code = "C66731") #> [1] "SEX"  # `code` is vectorized. clst_code_to_term(code = c("C66731", "C66733")) #> [1] "SEX"  "SIZE"  # Invalid codes (e.g. `"C007"`) map to `NA`. clst_code_to_term(code = c("C66731", "C66733", "C007")) #> [1] "SEX"  "SIZE" NA

what: SDTM code list term to respective code — clst_term_to_code
title: SDTM code list term to respective code — clst_term_to_code
text: clst_term_to_code() maps SDTM terminology codelists' terms respective C-codes. mapping terms representing codelists, use term_to_code() instead.

title: SDTM code list term to respective code — clst_term_to_code
code: clst_term_to_code(term)

title: SDTM code list term to respective code — clst_term_to_code
text: term SDTM controlled terminology term referring codelist.

title: SDTM code list term to respective code — clst_term_to_code
text: character vector SDTM codes codelists. number elements returned matches number elements term, .e. one--one correspondence input output. Invalid codes term mapped NA.

title: SDTM code list term to respective code — clst_term_to_code
code: clst_term_to_code(term = "SEX") #> [1] "C66731"  # `term` is vectorized. clst_term_to_code(term = c("SEX", "SIZE")) #> [1] "C66731" "C66733"  # Invalid codes (e.g. `"YODA"`) map to `NA`. clst_term_to_code(term = c("SEX", "SIZE", "YODA")) #> [1] "C66731" "C66733" NA

title: SDTM code to term — code_to_term
text: code_to_term() maps SDTM terminology C-codes respective terms. mapping codes representing codelists, use clst_code_to_term() instead.

title: SDTM code to term — code_to_term
code: code_to_term(code, clst_code)

title: SDTM code to term — code_to_term
text: code C-code leading character C followed sequence digits used uniquely identifying concept NCI Thesaurus (NCIt), including CDISC concepts. clst_code Parent codelist code.

title: SDTM code to term — code_to_term
text: character vector SDTM controlled terminology terms. number elements returned matches number elements code, .e. one--one correspondence input output. Invalid codes code mapped NA.

title: SDTM code to term — code_to_term
code: code_to_term(code = "C174106", clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] "TENMW101"  # Both `code` and `clst_code` are vectorized. `clst_code` will be recycled # to match `code` number of elements. code_to_term(code = c("C174106", "C141700"), clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] "TENMW101" "TENMW102"  # You may mix codelists as long as `code` and `clst_code` have the same # number of elements; they will be matched element-wise. code_to_term(   code = c("C174106", "C141700", "C141701"),   clst_code = c("C141657", "C141657", "C141656") ) #> [1] "TENMW101"          "TENMW102"          "TENMW1-Test Grade"  # Invalid codes (e.g. `"C00000"`) map to `NA`. code_to_term(code = c("C174106", "C141700", "C00000"), clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] "TENMW101" "TENMW102" NA

what: Retrieve CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — ct
title: Retrieve CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — ct
text: Returns tibble CDISC SDTM controlled terminology, optionally filtered include term-level entries, code list definitions, .

title: Retrieve CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — ct
code: ct(subset = c("term", "list", "all"))

title: Retrieve CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — ct
text: https://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/CDISC/SDTM/SDTM%20Terminology.txt

title: Retrieve CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — ct
text: subset One "term", "list", "" specify part terminology return.

title: Retrieve CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — ct
text: tibble containing requested subset CDISC controlled terminology: clst_code C-code code list term belongs . Identifies parent code list concept (e.g., C66742 Yes//Unknown). is_clst Logical indicator: TRUE row represents code list definition; FALSE represents term within code list. code C-code concept (either term code list). term list unique NCI Thesaurus concept code (e.g., C49487 "Yes"). term Submission value label term (e.g., "Y", "TENMW1-Walk/Run Performed"). code list rows, may list name. ext Extensibility code list (TRUE, FALSE, NA). NA term-level rows. name Name code list term category (e.g., "Yes//Unknown Response" "10-Meter Walk/Run Functional   Test Test Code"). syn Synonyms alternative names term, often used CRF annotations mappings. def Definition description term code list, taken NCI Thesaurus. nci Preferred label NCI Thesaurus; usually short human-readable label concept.

title: Retrieve CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — ct
text: Controlled terminology data comes release dated 2025-03-25.

title: Retrieve CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — ct

text: SDTM terminology release date.

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology Release Date — ct_release
text: Date object.

title: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology Release Date — ct_release

what: Is a code or term in a code list? — is_term
title: Is a code or term in a code list? — is_term
text: is_code() is_term() evaluate whether query codes terms part SDTM controlled terminology within context code list.

title: Is a code or term in a code list? — is_term
code: is_term(term, clst_code)  is_code(code, clst_code)

title: Is a code or term in a code list? — is_term
text: term character vector terms (e.g. "TENMW102"). clst_code character vector codes referring SDTM terminology codelists (e.g. "C141657"). code character vector C-codes (e.g. "C174106").

title: Is a code or term in a code list? — is_term
text: logical vector, TRUE indicates term controlled terminology term within clst_code provided, FALSE, otherwise.

title: Is a code or term in a code list? — is_term
code: is_term(term = "TENMW101", clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] TRUE  # Note that the clst_code term itself (`"TENMW1TC"`) is not part of its own # code list (`"C141657"`). is_term(term = "TENMW1TC", clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] FALSE  # `is_term()` is vectorized over `term` and `clst_code` is_term(term = c("TENMW101", "TENMW104"), clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] TRUE TRUE  is_code(code = "C174106", clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] TRUE  # Note that the code list code itself (`"C141657"`) is not part of its own # code list (`"C141657"`). is_code(code = "C141657", clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] FALSE  # `is_code()` is vectorized over `code` and `clst_code` is_code(code = c("C174106", "C141701"), clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] TRUE TRUE

title: Match code lists — match_code_list_from_term
text: match_code_list_from_term() takes terms queries look associated code lists. match_code_list_from_code() starting C-codes. Note mappings potentially one many code term may associate one code list.

title: Match code lists — match_code_list_from_term
code: match_code_list_from_term(term)  match_code_list_from_code(code)

title: Match code lists — match_code_list_from_term
text: term character vector SDTM terminology terms. code character vector SDTM terminology C-codes.

title: Match code lists — match_code_list_from_term
text: tibble least many rows elements term, potentially one--many mappings. returned tibble comprises three columns: code SDTM terminology code (e.g. "C141701"). term SDTM terminology term (e.g. "TENMW104"). clst_code code associated code list.

title: Match code lists — match_code_list_from_term
code: # Find code lists where "DNA" and "RNA" are used. match_code_list_from_term(c("DNA", "RNA")) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   code    term  clst_code #>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>     #> 1 C184459 DNA   C101832   #> 2 C449    DNA   C111114   #> 3 C135409 DNA   C65047    #> 4 C184459 DNA   C163027   #> 5 C812    RNA   C111114   #> 6 C132301 RNA   C65047     # Find code lists where "Yes"/"No" terms are controlled vocabulary. match_code_list_from_term(c("Yes", "No")) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   code    term  clst_code #>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>     #> 1 C182703 Yes   C182467   #> 2 C182745 Yes   C182471   #> 3 C182702 No    C182467   #> 4 C182744 No    C182471   #> 5 C180261 No    C179945   #> 6 C180271 No    C179947    # C163560 is found in code list C71620. match_code_list_from_code("C163560") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   code    term  clst_code #>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>     #> 1 C163560 %/s   C71620     # C25613 however is mapped to many code lists. match_code_list_from_code("C25613") #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   code   term  clst_code #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr>     #> 1 C25613 %     C85494    #> 2 C25613 %     C71620    #> 3 C25613 %     C66770     # Unmappable codes or terms map to `NA`. match_code_list_from_code("Yoda") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   code  term  clst_code #>   <chr> <chr> <chr>     #> 1 Yoda  NA    NA        match_code_list_from_term("R2D2") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   code  term  clst_code #>   <chr> <chr> <chr>     #> 1 NA    R2D2  NA         # Codes for code lists are for all intents and purposes not mappable to # parent code lists. match_code_list_from_code(code = "C141657") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   code    term  clst_code #>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>     #> 1 C141657 NA    NA

title: Get package name — pkg_name
text: pkg_name() returns package name.

title: Get package name — pkg_name
code: pkg_name()

title: Get package name — pkg_name
text: Package name character.

title: Get package version — pkg_version
text: pkg_name() returns package version

title: Get package version — pkg_version
code: pkg_version()

title: Get package version — pkg_version
text: Package version object class package_version.

what: sdtm.terminology: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — sdtm.terminology-package
title: sdtm.terminology: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — sdtm.terminology-package
text: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology Q1 2025, 2025-03-25 https://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/CDISC/SDTM/.

title: sdtm.terminology: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology — sdtm.terminology-package
text: Maintainer: Ramiro Magno rmagno@pattern.institute (ORCID) contributors: Pattern Institute [copyright holder, funder]

title: SDTM term to code — term_to_code
text: term_to_code() maps SDTM terminology terms respective C-codes. mapping terms referring codelists, use clst_term_to_code() instead.

title: SDTM term to code — term_to_code
code: term_to_code(term, clst_code)

title: SDTM term to code — term_to_code
text: term SDTM controlled terminology term (expected submissions). clst_code Parent codelist code.

title: SDTM term to code — term_to_code
text: character vector SDTM controlled terminology C-codes. number elements returned matches number elements term, .e. one--one correspondence input output. Invalid codes term mapped NA.

title: SDTM term to code — term_to_code
code: term_to_code(term = "TENMW101", clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] "C174106"  # Both `term` and `clst_code` are vectorized. `clst_code` will be recycled # to match `term` number of elements. term_to_code(term = c("TENMW101", "TENMW102"), clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] "C174106" "C141700"  # You may mix codelists as long as `term` and `clst_code` have the same # number of elements; they will be matched element-wise. term_to_code(   term = c("TENMW101", "TENMW102", "TENMW1-Test Grade"),   clst_code = c("C141657", "C141657", "C141656") ) #> [1] "C174106" "C141700" "C141701"  # Invalid terms (e.g. `"Gambelas"`) map to `NA`. term_to_code(term = c("TENMW101", "TENMW102", "Gambelas"), clst_code = "C141657") #> [1] "C174106" "C141700" NA

title: sdtm.terminology 0.0.1 (2024-02-14)
text: CDISC SDTM Controlled Terminology, Q4 2023, 2023-12-15.
